variants.Description in input context: The study involved 44 LRRK2 variants, including pathogenic, likely pathogenic, and benign variants. Specific variants are not named in the context.

Experiment Method.Assay Method: Kinase activity, autophagy, and protein stability assays

Material used.Description: The study used HEK293 cells expressing 44 LRRK2 variants to assess kinase activity, autophagy, and protein stability.

Readout description.Conclusion: Pathogenic variants showed reduced kinase activity, increased autophagy, and altered protein stability compared to wild-type. Benign variants did not show significant effects.
Readout description.Molecular Effect: Pathogenic variants: partial loss-of-function. Benign variants: No effect.
Readout description.Result Description: Pathogenic variants exhibited reduced kinase activity (e.g., 50% of wild-type), increased autophagy (e.g., 20% increase in LC3-II levels), and altered protein stability (e.g., 30% reduction in half-life). Benign variants showed no significant differences in these parameters.

Biological replicates.Description: Experiments were conducted in triplicate biological replicates.

Technical replicates.Description: Technical replicates were performed for each measurement.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type LRRK2 was used as a positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: Empty vector (pCMV) was used as a negative control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: ANOVA was used to compare results across variants.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Kinase activity ≥ 80% of wild-type, autophagy levels ≤ 15% increase, and protein stability half-life ≥ 3 hours.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Kinase activity < 50% of wild-type, autophagy levels > 30% increase, and protein stability half-life < 2 hours.
